column4: Anyone around that can help me with setting up a dual-boot Ubuntu 7.10 & Vista?
Just make sure you partition the space before you install to make it easy on yourself
the install has the option to do that right?  Or do I need to use a separate utility?
Well.. do you have your Vista installed already?
Do you know if you have free space on your hdd?
well I mean unused and unpartitioned space
It should, like I said, Vista was just fresh installed (reformat prior to reinstall)
Ok well then yes, you just throw in the LIVECD, boot it up (making sure your CDROM is first to boot) then click install and make sure you guide it through (so it doesn't erase your vista partition)
thanks... I messed that up last time I tried a dual boot (an xp machine) so it's now a pure ubuntu comp.  LOL
HAHA.. you sure tab doesn't work
now that this is back up and running correctly... I should select the 'guided - resize' option yeah?
I did... did you not receive it?
you get the pm this time?
No you sure you are PMing the right person
